page.title: 10Highfields Farm
page.content: On Highfields Farm there are 1500 pigs- 200 sows, 11 boars and 1300 piglets. Two men look after all these animals. They change into clean overalls and boots before entering the pens so that no diseases are carried to the animals. A vet visits the farm every 3 months. It is not economical to keep a sow with less than 8 piglets in a litter. The farmer has a new machine to prevent sows suffocating their piglets. A fan automatically switches on when the sow stands up. Cold air rushes in making the piglets move away. When the sow lies down the fan stops and the piglets return to feed. They are weaned when 21 days old. They eat dry protein-enriched pellets. Sows are mated again 5 days after weaning. Pigs reared for pork are sold at 16 weeks, those for bacon at 24 weeks.
